home Package¶

context_processors Module¶

Context processors for the Home app, which include login / registration via Userena.

These return dictionaries to be merged into a template context. Each function takes the request object as its only parameter and returns a dictionary to add to the context.

These are referenced from the setting TEMPLATE_CONTEXT_PROCESSORS and used by RequestContext.

django_eracks.apps.home.context_processors.registration_forms(request)¶

models Module¶

templets Module¶

django_eracks.apps.home.templets.orbit_featured_options = "\n$('#featured').orbit({\n animation: 'fade', // fade, horizontal-slide, vertical-slide, horizontal-push\n animationSpeed: 800, // how fast animtions are\n timer: true, // true or false to have the timer\n advanceSpeed: 4000, // if timer is enabled, time between transitions\n pauseOnHover: false, // if you hover pauses the slider\n startClockOnMouseOut: false, // if clock should start on MouseOut\n startClockOnMouseOutAfter: 1000, // how long after MouseOut should the timer start again\n directionalNav: true, // manual advancing directional navs\n captions: true, // do you want captions?\n captionAnimation: 'fade', // fade, slideOpen, none\n captionAnimationSpeed: 800, // if so how quickly should they animate in\n bullets: false, // true or false to activate the bullet navigation\n bulletThumbs: false, // thumbnails for the bullets\n bulletThumbLocation: '', // location from this file where thumbs will be\n afterSlideChange: function(){}, // empty function\n fluid: true // or set a aspect ratio for content slides (ex: '4x3')\n});\n"¶

tests Module¶

This file demonstrates writing tests using the unittest module. These will pass when you run “manage.py test”.

Replace this with more appropriate tests for your application.

class django_eracks.apps.home.tests.SimpleTest(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

test_basic_addition()¶

Tests that 1 + 1 always equals 2.
